intro: Tithymalus villosus, commonly known as the hairy tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its hairy stems and leaves give it a distinctive appearance, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Tithymalus villosus is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
